Package com.baylor.se.lms.controller

Class AuthorController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.baylor.se.lms.controller.AuthorController
  • @CrossOrigin(origins="*")
@RestController
public class AuthorController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller for Author Entity. Uses author service for all requests.

        @GetMapping(path="/authors",
            produces="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Author>> getAuthors()
        Handles Get request for url "/authors". It fetches all authors.
        Returns:
        Response with all authors

      • getAuthor

        @GetMapping(path="/authors/{id:[0-9][0-9]*}",
            produces="application/json")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Author> getAuthor​(@PathVariable
                                                                 java.lang.Long id)
        Handles Get request for url "/authors/{id}". It fetches author with "id".
        Parameters:
        id - : Author id
        Returns:
        Json Response of author

      • addAuthor

        @PostMapping(path="/authors/",
             consumes="application/json",
             produces="application/json")
@ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Author> addAuthor​(@RequestBody
                                                                 Author author)
        Handles POST Request to create author. It consumes json data of author and produces json with saved author.
        Parameters:
        author - : Author to be created
        Returns:
        Saved Author

      • updateAuthor

        @PutMapping(path="/authors/{id:[0-9][0-9]*}",
            consumes="application/json",
            produces="application/json")
@ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Author> updateAuthor​(@RequestBody
                                                                    Author author,
                                                                    @PathVariable
                                                                    java.lang.Long id)
        Handles PUT request to update author. It consumes JSON data of author to be updated. Uses Id from path variable to get existing author.
        Parameters:
        author - : Author details to be updated
        id - : author id
        Returns:
        Updated id

      • deleteAuthor

        @DeleteMapping(path="/authors/{id:[0-9][0-9]*}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteAuthor​(@PathVariable
                                                            java.lang.Long id)
        Handle DELETE request to soft delete author with id.
        Parameters:
        id - : Author id
        Returns:
        HTTP.ok
